intro: Albizia adinocephala, commonly known as the white-velvet acacia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant is recognized for its soft, fluffy pods that contain seeds, and its leaves are often trifoliate, consisting of three leaflets. Albizia adinocephala typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in open woodland or along riverbanks. Its ornamental value is notable due to its attractive foliage and showy flower clusters.
